item.title: Matthew Perry death: Friends stars and family remember 'brilliant' actor
item.description: The actor, best known for playing Chandler Bing, "brought so much joy to the world", his family said.

item.title: Baby joy for mum after two children killed in M4 crash
item.description: Summer-Gracie Lucas will never meet big sister Gracie-Ann and Jayden-Lee who were killed on the M4.

item.title: Thurrock tower block scaffolding 'is a ladder for cat burglars'
item.description: The scaffolding went up for works to improve the lives of residents but instead it has become the stuff of nightmares.

item.title: Anti-Israel mob storms Dagestan airport in Russia
item.description: Israel urges Russia to protect "all its citizens and all Jews" after a mob storms Makhachkala airport.

item.title: Kenya's school floggings: The children suffering from a hidden epidemic
item.description: BBC Africa Eye investigates an increase in severe and sometimes deadly beatings at Kenyan schools.

item.title: Fabio Grosso: Lyon manager 'seriously injured' as team bus attacked in Marseille
item.description: Lyon's Ligue 1 match at Marseille is postponed after visiting boss Fabio Grosso is "seriously injured" when his team's bus is attacked on the way to the ground.

item.title: Petrol retailers should cut price by 5p a litre, RAC says
item.description: The motoring body says major fuel retailers should reduce prices to reflect lower wholesale costs.

item.title: Leasehold law will be in King's Speech, says housing minister
item.description: Rachel MacLean says the bill would restore "true homeownership" but Labour says it is "thin gruel".

item.title: Luis Diaz: Major military and police search under way for Liverpool player's father
item.description: A major military and police search is under way for the father of Liverpool player Luis Diaz in Colombia, with the country's authorities offering a Â£40,000 reward for information leading to his rescue.

item.title: Matthew Perry's best moments as Chandler Bing
item.description: Many of Friends' funniest scenes relied on Chandler's quick wit or social awkwardness.

item.title: Gaza/Israel protests: Met Commissioner calls for clarity
item.description: Sir Mark Rowley says his officers are limited by legal definitions of extremism.

item.title: Coastguard search for man in water at Burnham-On-Sea
item.description: The HM Coastguard was called to Burnham-On-Sea at around 16:00 GMT on Sunday.

item.title: Fewer trains to run from London to Manchester
item.description: Avanti is to run a reduced service between London to Manchester on Saturdays until the end of the year.

item.title: The Papers: Tributes paid to Matthew Perry and UN Gaza warning
item.description: Tributes paid to late Friends star Matthew Perry and the latest on the conflict in Gaza leads Monday's front pages.

item.title: Matthew Perry obituary: Friends brought fame but couldn't quell personal demons
item.description: He starred in one of the most beloved TV shows ever, but was locked in a battle with addiction.

item.title: Chandler on Friends: A match made in comedy heaven
item.description: The late Friends actor found he was remarkably similar to his on-screen character, Chandler Bing.

item.title: Would you drink genetically modified beer?
item.description: A growing number of US brewers are now using GM yeast to make their beers.

item.title: Mixmups: Behind the scenes with the disabled stop motion characters
item.description: Mixmups is a new stop motion animation putting disabled characters front and centre.

item.title: 'My NHS hell waiting for surgery and information'
item.description: When former BBC correspondent Rory Cellan-Jones broke his elbow he waited days for an operation.

item.title: The Tanzanians searching for their grandfathers' skulls in Germany
item.description: Descendants of 19 men hanged 123 years ago have spent decades searching for their remains.

item.title: South Africa Rugby World Cup: The Springboks give hope to a troubled nation
item.description: As South Africa faces economic troubles the Rugby World Cup success is a welcome distraction.

item.title: UK braces for Storm CiarÃ¡n
item.description: The Met Office has named the third storm of the season. Ben Rich has the details.

item.title: London: Welsh miner's neon signs still illuminating Soho
item.description: Richard Bracey left the dark mines of the south Wales valleys in the 1940s for lighter work.

item.title: Fingernails: Film asks, what if a machine could find your life partner?
item.description: Jessie Buckley and Riz Ahmed star in Christos Nikou's intriguing drama about modern dating.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'hobbies'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

item.title: 'I wanted to continue modelling, wheelchair or no wheelchair'
item.description: Debbie-Lyn Connolly Lloyd says she thought a "devastating" diagnosis might end her modelling career.

item.title: PokÃ©mon Go creator John Hanke says it's not game over for the app
item.description: Despite a drop in players and job cuts, the boss of developer Niantic insists it's not game over.

item.title: Lost or stolen? The treasures missing from Scotland's museums
item.description: Thousands of items, including paintings and gems, are missing from galleries and museums.

item.title: Going undercover to reveal people smugglers' sales tactics
item.description: They say their routes from Pakistan are âsafeâ, with one claiming âhundredsâ are transported daily.

item.title: Adam Johnson: Nottingham Panthers forward dies after neck cut in Challenge Cup match
item.description: Nottingham Panthers' Adam Johnson dies after suffering a cut to his neck from a skate in a Challenge Cup match against the Sheffield Steelers.

item.title: Manchester United 0-3 Manchester City: Erling Haaland and Phil Foden secure derby victory
item.description: Erling Haaland scores twice and Phil Foden once as Manchester City beat Manchester United comfortably in the derby at Old Trafford.

item.title: Princess Leonor of Spain's royal profile rises as she turns 18
item.description: Princess Leonor of Spain's birthday is on Tuesday, prompting talk of what sort of royal she will be.

item.title: Belfast Royal Victoria Hospital: I'm nearly 80 and still nursing
item.description: "Unflappable" Jimmy turns 80 next month and is still working in intensive care at a Belfast hospital.

item.title: Bristol Old Vic theatre token from 1766 sold for Â£9k
item.description: The token, sold at auction on Saturday, grants the bearer free access to plays at the Bristol Old Vic.

item.title: Tears and relief in Maine after gunman's death
item.description: Some residents were emotional to learn that the hunt for the man accused of killing18 people was over.

item.title: Moment Czech president knocks soldier's hat off by striking him with flagpole
item.description: The officer later received an apology from President Petr Pavel who "simply underestimated the weight."

item.title: Brixton village: How the 'Oxford Street of South London' evolved
item.description: Brixton market has stood at the heart of this multicultural community for over 160 years.

item.title: Armita Geravand: Iranian girl who collapsed on Tehran metro dies
item.description: Authorities deny that Armita Geravand fell into a coma after being assaulted by morality police.

item.title: How South Africa became back-to-back champions
item.description: For South Africa, a country short on good news stories, losing the Rugby World Cup final and letting down 62 million people was unthinkable.

item.title: Sailor rescued after drifting for nearly two weeks in ocean
item.description: The man caught and ate a salmon to survive after nearly two weeks floating in the frigid Pacific Ocean.

item.title: Mike Pence: Former US Vice President withdraws from 2024 presidential race
item.description: The former US vice president says he has "no regrets" after ending his bid to be the Republican nominee.

item.title: Halloween: Social media pumpkin picking boost for farmers
item.description: Some farms say they can make Â£30,000 an acre by offering pick-your-own.

item.title: Sir Bobby Charlton: Boy, 17, charged over Manchester City chants
item.description: A boy is charged over chants about the Manchester United legend at a Manchester City match.

item.title: Abercrombie & Fitch and ex-CEO face sex-trafficking lawsuit
item.description: The US fashion brand is jointly accused with its former CEO of participating in a sex-trafficking venture.

item.title: Yousaf hits back after Elon Musk brands him 'racist'
item.description: Scotland's first minister reacted after Elon Musk commented on a clip of a speech he gave in 2020.

item.title: Manchester United 0-3 Manchester City: One-sided derby demonstrates gulf between clubs
item.description: Manchester United's campaign is resembling a dismal and rapid retreat after losing 3-0 to Manchester City, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: Mexico City Grand Prix: Max Verstappen wins restarted race after Kevin Magnussen crash
item.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen takes a dominant victory in the Mexico City Grand Prix to break his own record for wins in a single Formula 1 season.

item.title: Cricket World Cup 2023: 'England lose again as India look set to take over their mantle'
item.description: Hosts India are laser focused on winning the World Cup - and their thumping win over England suggests a changing of the guard.

item.title: ICC Cricket World Cup highlights: England beaten by India in latest capitulation
item.description: Watch highlights as England slump to another defeat, losing to India by 100 runs, as the hosts continued their unbeaten start to the Cricket World Cup in Lucknow.

item.title: BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2023: Will Alexandra Popp get your vote?
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Wolfsburg and Germany forward Alexandra Popp, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2023 award.

item.title: Garth Crooks' Team of the Week: Bernardo Silva, Mohamed Salah and Philip Billing
item.description: Which players impressed our football pundit Garth Crooks enough to make his latest Team of the Week?

item.title: âWe fought for our brotherâ â Klopp dedicates Liverpool win to Diaz
item.description: Liverpool's players show their support to absent team-mate Luis Diaz during a comfortable win over Nottingham Forest at Anfield.

item.title: UN: Thousands in Gaza break into warehouses in search of aid
item.description: People took flour, wheat and hygiene kits after storming several warehouses, a UN agency says.

item.title: Video said to show inside Al-Quds hospital after nearby explosion
item.description: People can be seen covering their mouths and noses inside the building, which is filled with smoke.

item.title: Lib Dem MP Layla Moran: Gazans asking 'where do we want to be when we die?'
item.description: Members of Lib Dem MP Layla Moran's extended family are sheltering in a church in Gaza.

item.title: The messages of fear that trickled out while Gaza was disconnected
item.description: A connectivity blackout on Saturday meant people could not contact friends, family or even ambulances to help the injured.

item.title: Israel has no plan for Gaza after war ends, experts warn
item.description: Former intelligence officers tell BBC it is unclear how Hamas could be kept out after Israeli forces leave.

item.title: What is happening in Israel and Gaza, and what is Hamas?
item.description: How is Israel responding to the deadly attack by Hamas three weeks ago?

item.title: 'Biggest ever' strikes hit northern Gaza
item.description: Gaza's health ministry, which is run by Hamas, says hundreds of Palestinians have been killed in the past 24 hours.

item.title: Gaza sees heaviest night of Israeli bombardment since start of war
item.description: Hamas-run authorities say hundreds of buildings were destroyed in the past day, with 377 people killed.

item.title: Pro-Palestinian protest in London sees thousands call for bombing to stop
item.description: Tens of thousands of people join demonstrations across the UK demanding an end to Israel's attacks.

item.title: We don't know if family is dead in Gaza - Humza Yousaf
item.description: First Minister Humza Yousaf reiterated his call for a ceasefire as thousands joined rallies in Scotland.

item.title: Israeli troops clear Gaza areas 'slice by slice', but is this an invasion?
item.description: The Israeli army is focusing on northern Gaza in what promises to be a very large military operation.

item.title: Gaza before and after: Satellite images show destruction
item.description: Israeli aerial strikes on the Palestinian territory have reduced parts of the north to rubble.

item.title: Hospitals struggle amid Israeli attacks on Gaza
item.description: The BBC's Rushdi Abualouf gives an update on the situation at medical facilities across Gaza.

item.title: BBC reports from Gaza after heaviest Israeli bombing yet
item.description: Rushdi Abualouf reports from Khan Younis after the most intense bombing of the war so far.

item.title: Could an Israeli ground invasion of Gaza meet its aims?
item.description: Israeli forces are expanding ground operations in Gaza, and their ultimate goal is to dismantle Hamas.

item.title: Israel angrily dismisses UN truce resolution on Gaza
item.description: The UN General Assembly has called for an immediate humanitarian truce between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: Israel-Gaza: Explosions pierce Gaza darkness as Israel steps up bombing
item.description: Israel's attacks in Gaza intensified on Friday night, and Gaza was left in darkness.

item.title: Hostage negotiations appear to have stopped - Jeremy Bowen
item.description: Israel and Hamas were discussing a possible ceasefire and exchange of hostages.

item.title: People in Gaza uncontactable and all communication down as Israel intensifies bombing
item.description: The Palestinian Red Crescent says people cannot call the emergency 101 number due to the outage.

item.title: When should I turn the heating on?
item.description: As it gets colder here are some tips to help you stay warm while trying to keep your energy bills down.

item.title: Energy price cap: What is it and will bills continue to go down?
item.description: The price cap which sets typical annual household energy bills is falling slightly from October.

item.title: Energy bills: What can I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: If you're struggling to afford your gas and electricity bills, what options are available?

item.title: Interest rate and mortgages: What you can do about rising payments
item.description: Watch the BBC's Lora Jones tell you five things you can do about your mortgage, in a minute.

item.title: Food prices: How can I save money on my grocery shop?
item.description: The cost-of-living crisis continues to bite. Here are some things that can reduce the impact.
